headline: Chamber of Commerce Sues Over Trump’s $100,000 H-1B Visa Fee
summary: The US Chamber of Commerce said in a lawsuit Thursday that it was illegal for President Donald Trump to slap a $100,000 fee on new H-1B visa applications because it overrides federal immigration law requirements.  “The new $100,000 visa fee will make it cost-prohibitive for U.S. employers, especially start-ups and small and midsize businesses, to utilize the H-1B program, which was created by Congress expressly to ensure that American businesses of all sizes can access the global talent they need to grow their operations here in the U.S.,” Neil Bradley, executive vice president of the Chamber of Commerce, said in a statement.  The Chamber polled its members over whether they would be willing to join a lawsuit against the H-1B visa policy change after Trump disclosed the fee in September.

raw.headline: Chamber of Commerce Sues Over Trump’s $100,000 H-1B Visa Fee
raw.summary: The US Chamber of Commerce said in a lawsuit Thursday that it was illegal for President Donald Trump to slap a $100,000 fee on new H-1B visa applications because it overrides federal immigration law requirements.  “The new $100,000 visa fee will make it cost-prohibitive for U.S. employers, especially start-ups and small and midsize businesses, to utilize the H-1B program, which was created by Congress expressly to ensure that American businesses of all sizes can access the global talent they need to grow their operations here in the U.S.,” Neil Bradley, executive vice president of the Chamber of Commerce, said in a statement.  The Chamber polled its members over whether they would be willing to join a lawsuit against the H-1B visa policy change after Trump disclosed the fee in September.

headline: Apple Readies Its First Ever Touch-Screen MacBook
summary: The company is readying a revamped MacBook Pro with a touch display for late 2026 or early 2027, according to people with knowledge of the matter.  In making the move, Apple is following the rest of the computing industry, which embraced touch-screen laptops more than a decade ago.  Bloomberg News first reported in January 2023 that Apple was working on a touch-screen MacBook Pro.

headline: Regard to Improve Patient Care and Unlock Revenue at Scale Through Microsoft Dragon Copilot Collaboration
summary: Regard, the leading Proactive Documentation platform that reviews all data in the electronic health record (EHR) to recommend diagnoses, today announced a collaboration to integrate its platform with Microsoft Dragon Copilot, an AI clinical assistant. The integration will enable broad access to Regard's capabilities for surfacing diagnostic insights and critical clinical context in real-time from EHR data, combined with Dragon Copilot's natural language, ambient, and generative AI capabilities.

summary: NEW YORK, October 16, 2025--Proxima, a data intelligence platform that specializes in precision marketing, today announced that they are leveraging Microsoft Curate for Commerce to enable advertisers to target their social-first, first-party ecommerce transaction-based audiences across Microsoft Monetize supply. headline: Macquarie confident in AI, data centre future after $40 billion Aligned sale
summary: SYDNEY (Reuters) -The head of Australia's Macquarie Asset Management (MAM), which sold its Aligned Data Centers business in a deal worth $40 billion, said on Thursday the sale was not a sign the global data centre boom had peaked.  Aligned emerged as one of the world's largest data centre operators during the seven years it was owned by MAM, the funds management arm of investment bank Macquarie Group.  MAM head Ben Way said the decision to sell to investors including BlackRock, Microsoft and Nvidia, was not a warning sign for the sector or AI.

raw.headline: Macquarie confident in AI, data centre future after $40 billion Aligned sale
raw.summary: SYDNEY (Reuters) -The head of Australia's Macquarie Asset Management (MAM), which sold its Aligned Data Centers business in a deal worth $40 billion, said on Thursday the sale was not a sign the global data centre boom had peaked.  Aligned emerged as one of the world's largest data centre operators during the seven years it was owned by MAM, the funds management arm of investment bank Macquarie Group.  MAM head Ben Way said the decision to sell to investors including BlackRock, Microsoft and Nvidia, was not a warning sign for the sector or AI.
